qas.question: What was the movement called also known as execution of laws?
What were the intentions of executionists movement?

answers.text: seek to curb the power of the magnates at the Sejm and to strengthen the power of king and country

qas.question: what did the Sejm in Piotrków forced the magnates to do?

answers.text: return many leased crown lands to the king,

qas.question: What happened when Jan Zamoyski died?

context: About that time the <a0_0>"executionist movement<a0_0/>" (Polish: "egzekucja praw"--"execution of the laws") began to take form. Its members would <a1_0>seek to curb the power of the magnates at the Sejm and to strengthen the power of king and country<a1_0/>. In 1562 at the Sejm in Piotrków they would force the magnates to <a2_0>return many leased crown lands to the king,<a2_0/> and the king to create a standing army (wojsko kwarciane). One of the most famous members of this movement was Jan Zamoyski. After his death in <a3_0>1605<a3_0/>, the <a4_0>movement lost its political force.
